title:
The Number of Subgroups and Cyclic Subgroups of Finite Group and Its
  Application by GAP Program
abstract:
In this paper, we present a novel approach for calculating the set of
subgroups of a finite group, focusing on cyclic subgroups, and using it to
establish the quantity of all subgroups in the direct product of two groups.
Specifically, we consider the Dicyclic group of order \(4n\) and the Cyclic
group of order \(p\). Let \(\tau(n)\) denote the total number of divisors of
\(n\), and \(\sigma(n)\) denote the summation of all divisors of \(n\). Using
these functions, we derive a formula for the number of subgroups in the group
\(T_{4n} \times C_p\). We then use the computer program GAP to find all
\(T_{4n} \times C_p\) with exactly \(|T_{4n} \times C_p| - t\) cyclic subgroups
for \(t \geq 1\).
